metadata.description: Grammatical structure analysis of Rongorongo script
metadata.methodology: Based on lexicon analysis, PDF insights, and Polynesian linguistic patterns
metadata.confidence: moderate - proto-writing nature limits grammatical analysis

characteristics: Encodes key concept-words for oral expansion
script_nature.implication: Grammar is partially implicit, inferred by knowledgeable reader

examples: Person A (glyph 76 = procreation marker) Person B
genealogical_formula.notes: Older texts use explicit kinship markers (glyph 76), later texts use juxtaposition

title_formula.notes: Chief glyph (variant human figure with headdress) precedes name

procreation_formula.notes: Glyph 76 = phallic symbol indicating procreation, literally 'mated with'

sequential_listing.description: Simple name succession without explicit markers
sequential_listing.notes: Later, streamlined genealogies omit explicit kinship markers

basic_order.description: Rongorongo follows Polynesian patterns with flexible word order
basic_order.note: Proto-writing nature means strict word order less critical than in fully phonetic scripts

genealogical_sequences.description: Names listed in generational order, top to bottom or left to right

noun_phrases.description: Polynesian languages vary; Rapa Nui tends head-initial
noun_phrases.note: More data needed for confirmation in rongorongo

plural_marker.usage: Added to nouns to indicate plurality

procreation_marker.usage: Connects parent to offspring in genealogies
procreation_marker.evidence: Santiago Staff, explicit in ceremonial texts

section_divider.evidence: Tablets G, K, A show consistent divider use

chief_marker.description: Special variant of human figure with headdress
chief_marker.evidence: Appears before names in royal genealogies

phonotactic_constraints.note: See analysis/constraints.json for Polynesian phonotactic rules
phonotactic_constraints.relevance: Applies to oral realization, not script structure

key_findings.genealogical_formulas: Multiple patterns identified, including explicit procreation markers and implicit juxtaposition
key_findings.title_patterns: Consistent TITLE + NAME ordering in royal genealogies
key_findings.evolution: Script shows evolution from explicit markers (older texts) to streamlined juxtaposition (later texts)
key_findings.parallel_texts: Same genealogical sequences appear across multiple tablets, suggesting standardized formulas

limitations.incomplete_corpus: Many grammatical details must be inferred from limited texts
limitations.proto_writing_ambiguity: Not a full writing system; some grammar exists only in oral recitation
limitations.variant_readings: Multiple interpretations possible for complex passages

next_steps: Phase 16: Integrate cultural context for disambiguation
Phase 17: Apply patterns to generate sense-weighted readings
